channel.title: Projects on Remco van Dijk
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Remco van Dijk

item.title: HASC-V
item.description: I’m currently working on a RISC-V simulator in Haskell as a side project. You can find more information about it on the HASC-V github page. At some point, I will write a proper article about it here.

item.title: MSc Thesis
item.description: I’m currently doing my Master’s thesis entitled: “Fault Injection Attacks on Trusted Execution for RISC-V Cores” at the CAES group at the University of Twente. Motivation Link to heading As the RISC-V Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) grows in popularity, it becomes a greater target for malicious behavior. When RISC-V cores are deployed in embedded systems (which is currently the main use case), there is often a need for facilitating secure firmware updates over the air, which can be achieved by Trusted Execution.
